cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 95 mi SSE of the mouth of the Mississippi River or 200 mi SE of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn west-northwest tonight, then northwest on Friday, moving toward and onto the central Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast near or just west of Morgan City

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch – east of the Mouth of the Pearl River to the MS/AL border; Lake Pontchartrain & Lake Maurepas including metro New Orleans
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning – Mouth of the Pearl River to Morgan City LA; Storm Surge Warning – Mouth of the Atchafalaya River to Shell Beach LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast, especially Louisiana and southern Mississippi
weather_observation.wind: Only a slight (≤4%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; breezy conditions possible Saturday
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant surge expected along the mid-Texas coast; winds will be offshore
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer bands may bring 1–3 inches of rain, mainly Saturday into early Sunday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas and rip currents in the near-shore approaches of Matagorda and Lavaca Bays
